intro: Othocallis leepii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its stems are often hairy, and it produces a milky sap that is a common feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Othocallis leepii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
